summary: This is a very easy, small and scriptfree Mod, which adds an additional basic Stamina Managment to meelefighting and archery.
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=5]


[/size][/b][center][b][size=5][u][size=6]Simple Stamina Managment[/size][/u][/size][/b]
[size=4]for Meele Fighting and Archery[/size]

[u][b][size=5]1.3[/size][/b][/u]



This is a very easy and small Mod, which adds an additional basic Stamina Managment to meelefighting and archery.
It is only affecting the player. I use it as a Plugin for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/5485/?]Deadly Combat by Borgut1337[/url] together with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56147/?]Combat envolved by CrushBoss[/url],
but it also works fully as a standalone, or together with other combat-mods, perk mods etc...
To Balance the Mod (and all your other Mods) to your taste, use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37563/?]Fine-Tuned Challenge by Kamikaze1[/url] or similar.
(it basicly enhances the difficulty-slider, for example you can make only your hits stronger, now that you may can perform less hits)[/center][center]This Mod is Scriptfree!

[size=5]
[u]Description:[/u][/size]
[u]
1a. every normal weapon swing will now cost 10 Stamina[/u]
[u]1b. keeping a Bow drawn and reloading a crossbow drains 10 Stamina per second[/u]
a very small amount, but while you keep swinging your weapon, you can't regenerate stamina[i]
... now you have to be more carefully with your attacks, because no stamina means no Powerattacks, no Powerbashing and no sprinting[/i]
... archery-handling and movement gets also more complex

[u]2. while you have more than 80% of your Stamina, you do 30% more damage[/u]
while you are infight your charcter will have a blue glow if you're above 80% stamina
[i]... a rested figther is more likely to do a well placed hit[/i]
... if you have proper timing in aiming, drawing and shooting your bow, you get a bonus

[u]3. while you have less than 20% of your Stamina, you do 70% less damage[/u]
your charcter will have a green glow if you have less than 20% stamina
[i]... [/i][i]if you're exhausted you can't hit that hard
... with Deadly Combat blocking costs stamina, so now evading hits is better than just blocking it[/i]
... keeping distance as an archer now comes at a price if you use sprint[/center]
[center][u][size=4]Compatibility:[/size][/u]
There are no Incompatibilities with other Mods, since I didn't change any Vanilla-record. I just added new ones.
Even if you have a Mod, which does exactly the same, the effects would just stack.
Works with every Mod-added meeleweapon. There is no need for any DLC. You don't need to start a new game to use the Mod.[/center]


[center][u][size=4]Installation:[/size][/u]
Use Modmanager or simply copy SimpleStaminaManagment.esp in your \Skyrim\Data Folder and activate it.

[b]1. Ingame, open console and type "help staminamanagment" [i](without " "). [/i][/b]
[i]This will show you a Perk (SimpleStaminaManagment) and its ID.[/i]

[b]2. The ID will look like XXX00D64 [/b]
[i](XXX will be the position of this Mod in your loadorder, for example "96000D64").[/i]

[b]3. Then type "player.addperk XXX00D64" [/b]
[i](replace XXX with the numbers, which showed, type the whole number with all zeros).[/i]

[b]4. Save your game[/b][/center][center]

[b][u]For Update from previous Version:[/u][/b]
Please follow the Uninstall-section first, then
install the normal way[/center]

[center][u][size=4]Uninstallation:[/size][/u]
Uninstallation mid-game works, since this mod does not use scripts.

[b]1. Ingame, open console and type "help staminamanagment" [i](without " ")[/i][/b]
[i]This will show you a Perk (SimpleStaminaManagment) and its ID.[/i]

[b]2. The ID will look like XXX00D64 [/b]
[i](XXX will be the position of this Mod in your loadorder, for example "96000D64").[/i]

[b]3. Then type "player.removeperk XXX00D64" [/b]
[i](replace XXX with the numbers, which showed, type the whole number with all zeros).[/i]

[b]4. Save your game[/b]

[b]5. Delete SimpleStaminaManagment.esp in your \Skyrim\Data Folder or uninstall with Modmanager.
[/b][/center]


[center]______________________________________________________________________________
[/center][center][size=3]There is another Mod, similar to mine. Since it's re-realease, this Mod is way more polished than mine and adds some additional feautures, except for the blue/green glow. 
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59742/?]Fighting Fatigue by Matthiaswagg
[/url] [/size][/center][center]______________________________________________________________________________[/center]
